Hey! I am diabetic as well.  Been that way for 19+years.  Diabetes should not make him sterile, it is a possibility though.  Like the others said, if you have been pregnant before, it is very uncommon to just become sterile without surgery or some other traumatic event.  Diabetic  men usually dont have much trouble.  From what i have read, i hate to say it, but it seems like the problem may be with you.  Have you always been regular?  Do you have a family history of pregnancy problems? Spontaneous Abortion can happen to anyone, but usually if it happens one time, it can mean other problems.  You should go see your gyno and get checked out. If you dont find anything there, then get his sperm count checked.  If he is not sterile, and you are ok, maybe IVF is a possibility (in vetro fertilization).  That is what we are facing now, only we are trying to find a surrogate mother to have my egg (fertilized by hubby's sperm) implanted in her and she will carry baby to term.  That way baby is still genetically ours.  Good luck and if I can help you any, my e-mail addy is ***@****  Good Luck!!you are in my prayers.Christina
